definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: He's a deadbeat and a hypocrite.

sentences.chinese: 他是世界第一的伪君子。

sentences.english: They are, to a man, the greatest pack of hypocrites in football.
sentences.chinese: 这群人就是足球界中最恶劣的一群伪君子。

sentences.english: According to knowing he is a hypocrite.
You can become an idiot, or you can become a hypocrite.
sentences.chinese: 要么成为傻瓜，要么变成伪君子。

sentences.english: The hypocrites' club now get a new diamond-level member.
sentences.chinese: 伪君子俱乐部迎来一位新的钻石会员。

sentences.english: Try as we might to be otherwise, we are all hypocrites.
sentences.chinese: 把自己扮演成完全不一样的人，恩，我们全是伪君子。

sentences.english: Henry was more than a bigot. He was also a hypocrite.
sentences.chinese: 亨利不只是一个顽固执拗的人，他还是个伪君子。

sentences.english: Is he turning out a bit of a hypocrite, and coming into the country to work mischief under a cloak?
sentences.chinese: 他变得有点像伪君子了，乔装改扮了到乡间来害人吗？

sentences.english: But there are pretenders everywhere in life and that does not stop us from participating.
sentences.chinese: 我们的生活中伪君子无处不在，没有人能摆脱这些人。

sentences.english: The man was the foulest hypocrite that I ever saw in a high position.
sentences.chinese: 在我所见过的高层人士中，诺顿是最下流的伪君子。

sentences.english: Do you think either of these men is a hypocrite?
sentences.chinese: 你认为这两人中有人是伪君子吗？

sentences.english: I belong to the kind-ling to do truly mean and the hypocrites do, .
sentences.chinese: 我是属于那种宁做真小人，不做伪君子的，。

sentences.english: She ripped off the mask of the hypocrite mercilessly.
sentences.chinese: 她毫不留情地剥掉这个伪君子的画皮。

sentences.english: Yes, these products make hypocrites of us all.
sentences.chinese: 是的，这些产品把我们都变成了伪君子。

sentences.english: That handsome Alpha Male is a hypocrite.
sentences.chinese: 那个帅气的头人是一个伪君子。

definition: human face, beast's heart (idiom); two-faced/malicious and duplicitous
two-faced, three knives (idiom); double-cross/double dealing and back stabbing
to fool the world and usurp a good name (idiom)
lit. dressed up animal (idiom)/fig. immoral and despicable person
sordid and contemptible (idiom); vile and repulsive (esp. character or action)
compassion, duty, propriety and integrity (idiom); all the traditional virtues/mainly used sarcastically, to mean hypocritical
lit. honeyed words, a sword in the belly (idiom); fig. hypocritical and murderous
to angle for fame (idiom)/to fish for compliments
